pr_title: Add support for processing WAN replication messages from 3.x members

timeline.message: wip
wip

Add support for processing WAN replication messages from 3.x members

Adds support on PASSIVE (target) cluster to be able to deserialize and
process WAN replication events from a 3.x ACTIVE (source) cluster.

Add support for processing WAN replication messages from 3.x members

Adds support on PASSIVE (target) cluster to be able to deserialize and
process WAN replication events from a 3.x ACTIVE (source) cluster.

Add support for processing WAN replication messages from 3.x members

Adds support on PASSIVE (target) cluster to be able to deserialize and
process WAN replication events from a 3.x ACTIVE (source) cluster.

Add support for processing WAN replication messages from 3.x members

Adds support on PASSIVE (target) cluster to be able to deserialize and
process WAN replication events from a 3.x ACTIVE (source) cluster.

timeline.bodyText: Not a big thing, but it seems the constants other than DEFAULT_CACHE_ENTRY_VIEW can be removed.
timeline.author: blazember

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I could not decide if I should remove ALL unused constants or leave them, in all of the factories and helper classes. I guess I left them in case I needed them in the future when I would discover I forgot to cover some edge case.
replies.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: Done, removed all unused constants in a separate commit.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: Minor suggestion: we can create constructors that hide the false compatibility flag so that we have to touch only places where using the given classes in "compatibility mode" is possible.
timeline.author: blazember

replies.bodyText: Sure, I guess I preferred all code to be explicit about what they want but avoiding unnecessary changes works fine too :)
replies.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: Done, added new constructors so that all of the existing code is unaffected.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.author: blazember

replies.bodyText: I think I copied that one from the previous compatibility code, not sure what's the reason behind it but I guess it was just trying to be on the safe side - if we still haven't figured out which map the user is sending across classloaders, better make it a thread-safe map in case it's going to be used from different threads. Later I added the cases for specific implementations so this clause is probably going to be a lot less used.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.author: vbekiaris

replies.bodyText: Done, changed in both this and the 3.12.z PR.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.author: vbekiaris

replies.bodyText: Strike two with using JCache classes eagerly where I was not supposed to (I remember one time where I was resolving some classes during node startup :)). Will update the code to what you suggested.
replies.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: Misunderstood the first time but now it's clear. Thanks for the suggestion. Added a test for the constructor as well and applied changes to 3.12.z PR.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: minor: could move raising FLAG_4_0 to Packet constructor as done in other PR
timeline.author: vbekiaris

replies.bodyText: Sure, I was planning on doing it 👍
replies.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: Done, updated in this and the 3.12.z PR. Now I only had to unset the flag when sending to 3.12 members and set the FLAG_3_12 flag, which is kinda ugly but the rest of the code using Packets is now unaffected.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.author: vbekiaris

replies.bodyText: Fixed in both this and the 3.12.z PR.
replies.author: mmedenjak
